title: IPython Notebook kernel dies when importing tensorflow
body_html:
Environment info

Operating System: nvidia-docker (Docker version 1.11.2, build b9f10c9)
Tensorflow version 0.8.0

Steps to reproduce

  1. Run ipyhton notebook from nvidia-docker
  2. import tensorflow
  3. Kernel dies with Kernel Restarting dialog and message "The kernel appears to have died. It will restart automatically"
  4. importing numpy package before importing tensorflow solves the issue.
body_text:
Environment info
Operating System: nvidia-docker (Docker version 1.11.2, build b9f10c9)
Tensorflow version 0.8.0
Steps to reproduce

Run ipyhton notebook from nvidia-docker
import tensorflow
Kernel dies with Kernel Restarting dialog and message "The kernel appears to have died. It will restart automatically"
importing numpy package before importing tensorflow solves the issue.
body:
### Environment info

Operating System: nvidia-docker (Docker version 1.11.2, build b9f10c9)
Tensorflow version 0.8.0
### Steps to reproduce
1. Run ipyhton notebook from nvidia-docker
2. import tensorflow
3. Kernel dies with Kernel Restarting dialog and message "The kernel appears to have died. It will restart automatically"
4. importing numpy package before importing tensorflow solves the issue.
